docs.abstract: Chicago Bulls defeat New York Knicks, 118-111, in overtime; Bulls guard Nate Robinson scores 35 points.

docs.snippet:
On Dec. 26 the Brooklyn Nets lost to the Milwaukee Bucks,  their 10th loss in 13 games  after a franchise-best 11-4 start.
   
The next day,  Coach Avery Johnson was fired  — a mere 24 days after being named the Eastern Conference c...
docs.lead_paragraph:
On Dec. 26 the Brooklyn Nets lost to the Milwaukee Bucks, their 10th loss in 13 games after a franchise-best 11-4 start.
 
The next day, Coach Avery Johnson was fired — a mere 24 days after being named the Eastern Conference coach of the month for November — and was replaced by his assistant P. J. Carlesimo.
docs.abstract: Keeping Score blog; Brooklyn Nets are close to locking down the fourth seed in the Eastern Conference and home-court advantage in the first round of the playoffs. Photo (M)/

docs.snippet: John J. Farmer Jr., the dean of Rutgers School of Law-Newark since 2009, will replace John B. Wolf, who resigned last week amid a basketball scandal....
docs.lead_paragraph: John J. Farmer Jr., the dean of Rutgers School of Law-Newark since 2009, will replace John B. Wolf, who resigned last week amid a basketball scandal.
docs.abstract: Rutgers University names John J Farmer Jr as senior vice president and general counsel; appointment comes amid scandal about Mike Rice, men's basketball coach fired for abusive language and physical aggression against student players; Farmer replaces John B Wolf, who resigned along with athletic director Tim Pernetti.

headline.seo: John J. Farmer Jr. Named Senior Vice President at Rutgers
headline.main: Rutgers Names Replacement for Counsel Who Resigned
headline.print_headline: Rutgers Names Replacement For Counsel Who Resigned

docs.snippet: The Satmar view the vacant National Guard building in Williamsburg as a possible solution to a space crunch in its schools and synagogues and a bitter schism....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Satmar view the vacant National Guard building in Williamsburg as a possible solution to a space crunch in its schools and synagogues and a bitter schism.
docs.abstract: Satmar Hasidim sect is considering purchasing vacant National Guard armory building in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, viewing site as ideal location for a large school, along with housing and community halls; Empire State Development Corporation, a state authority, plans soon to put out a request for proposals for the site.

headline.seo: Hasidic Sect May Buy Huge Brooklyn Armory

docs.snippet: The N.H.L. has formed a partnership with a gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and the N.F.L. is looking to smooth the way for acceptance....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.H.L. has formed a partnership with a gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and the N.F.L. is looking to smooth the way for acceptance.
docs.abstract: Four major professional sports leagues in the United States, with growing expectations that gay male athlete will soon come out publicly for first time, are exploring ways to accommodate and respond to announcement; National Hockey League forms partnership with gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and National Football League is looking to smooth the way for acceptance.

headline.seo: Major Pro Leagues Prepare for the ‘I’m Gay’ Announcement
headline.main: Major Sports Leagues Prepare for the ‘I’m Gay’ Disclosure
headline.print_headline: Major Sports Leagues Prepare For the ‘I’m Gay’ Disclosure
